columns.name: db_proxy_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the proxy

columns.name: created_date
columns.description: The date and time when the proxy was first created.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The current status of this proxy.

columns.name: debug_logging
columns.description: Whether the proxy includes detailed information about SQL statements in its logs.

columns.name: endpoint
columns.description: The endpoint that you can use to connect to the DB proxy.

columns.name: engine_family
columns.description: The kinds of databases that the proxy can connect to.

columns.name: idle_client_timeout
columns.description: The number of seconds a connection to the proxy can have no activity before the proxy drops the client connection.

columns.name: require_tls
columns.description: Indicates whether Transport Layer Security (TLS) encryption is required for connections to the proxy.

columns.name: role_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role that the proxy uses to access Amazon Secrets Manager.

columns.name: updated_date
columns.description: The date and time when the proxy was last updated.

columns.name: vpc_id
columns.description: Provides the VPC ID of the DB proxy.

columns.name: auth
columns.description: One or more data structures specifying the authorization mechanism to connect to the associated RDS DB instance or Aurora DB cluster.

columns.name: vpc_security_group_ids
columns.description: Provides a list of VPC security groups that the proxy belongs to.

columns.name: vpc_subnet_ids
columns.description: The EC2 subnet IDs for the proxy.
